text: Chinese tech giants pause stablecoin plans after Beijing steps in, FT reports. Chinese tech giants including Alibaba-backed Ant Group and e-commerce group JD.com have paused plans to issue stablecoins in Hong Kong after the government raised concerns about the rise of currencies controlled by the private sector, the Financial Times reported on Saturday.
label: negative

text: Vox Royalty: Acquisitions And Commodity Tailwinds Fuel Growth. Vox Royalty is transitioning from a gold-focused royalty portfolio to a diversified mix with increased copper and battery metals exposure, capitalizing on secular demand trends. VOXR's recent $60 million global gold royalty acquisition and strong balance sheet position it for robust growth while maintaining prudent leverage and increasing dividends. Despite a Q2 revenue dip due to iron ore weakness, VOXR's gold assets are ramping up, and management reaffirms 2025 revenue guidance of $13–$15 million, with multiple growth catalysts ahead.

text: Companies are blaming AI for job cuts. Critics say it's a 'good excuse'. Companies across the U.S. and Europe have been cutting staff, citing the impact of artificial intelligence. There may be more to the layoffs than meets the eye as firms are "scapegoating" the technology to take the fall for challenging business moves such as layoffs, according to one professor.

text: Webster Financial: Attractive Given HSA Growth And Modest NDFI Exposure. Webster Financial (WBS) is a compelling buy after a recent pullback, supported by strong Q3 results and resilient loan book quality. WBS benefits from a unique, fast-growing HSA deposit platform, which lowers funding costs and is poised for secular growth due to regulatory changes. While WBS has meaningful CRE and NDFI exposure, its diversified portfolio, conservative lending, and solid capital position mitigate credit risk concerns.
label: positive

text: Gilead Sciences Breaks Out To Record Highs, The Rally Has Room To Run. Gilead Sciences (GILD) is a top-performing healthcare stock in 2025, up 36% YTD and breaking out to all-time highs. GILD's strong Q2 results, raised guidance, and robust HIV portfolio drive optimism, with FDA approval and delayed Biktarvy exclusivity boosting long-term prospects. Valuation remains attractive, with technical analysis signaling potential upside to $150 in the near term and $185 longer term.
label: positive

text: CASE REPORT | PRELIMINARY CLINICAL DATA OF CARSGEN'S ALLOGENEIC BCMA CAR-T PRODUCT CT0596 FOR THE TREATMENT OF PRIMARY PLASMA CELL LEUKEMIA. SHANGHAI , OCT. 19, 2025 /PRNEWSWIRE/ -- PRIMARY PLASMA CELL LEUKEMIA (PPCL) IS A RARE AND HIGHLY AGGRESSIVE PLASMA CELL MALIGNANCY, OFTEN ASSOCIATED WITH COMPLEX GENETIC ABNORMALITIES. THERE IS CURRENTLY NO STANDARD TREATMENT REGIMENS, AND CONVENTIONAL THERAPIES FOR MULTIPLE MYELOMA ARE TYPICALLY USED.

text: Can This Beaten-Down Stock Turn a $10,000 Investment Into $20,000 by 2030?. Buying stocks while they continue to post strong returns and trade near record highs might not be the strategy that certain investors want to pursue. Instead, their attention could be on businesses whose share prices have gotten crushed, in the hopes that a successful turnaround could lead to impressive portfolio gains.

While the broader outlook remains constructive, the immediate advance may be vulnerable from these levels as the exhaustion signals mount.

text: SPVU: Low Valuation, Concentrated Sector Mix. The Invesco S&P 500 Enhanced Value ETF (SPVU) offers deep value exposure, heavily overweighting financials, energy, and healthcare while underweighting technology. SPVU trades at a significant valuation discount (11.5x P/E) to the S&P 500 and peers, but lags on profitability and earnings growth due to its sector mix. The fund outperformed peers and the S&P 500 over five years, driven by financials and energy, but has higher volatility and limited liquidity.

text: Why Robinhood Markets Stock Zoomed 38% Higher Last Month. Robinhood Markets (HOOD -1.19%) had a scorching hot September, with its stock rising 38% from beginning to end and trouncing the 3.5% rise of the S&P 500 index. We shouldn't find this too surprising, however, as the next-generation brokerage and fintech has had several strong months since the start of the year.
